byline.contributor: Javier C. Hernández contributed reporting from Beijing.

abstract: British Prime Min Theresa May approves plan to build nuclear plant partly financed by China and France after abandoning several of her predecessor David Cameron's domestic policies.

keywords.value: Hinkley Point C Nuclear Power Plant (England)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The project, financed in part with French and Chinese investment, had been postponed in July, angering its international partners.
snippet: The project, financed in part with French and Chinese investment, had been postponed in July, angering its international partners....

headline.main: Hinkley Point Nuclear Plant Will Go Ahead, Britain Says
headline.print_headline: Britain Gives O.K. to Build Nuclear Plant Tied to China
